item.description:
Cards for this game come packaged with the 2009 Mythology Calendar published by Andrew McMeel Publishing.

This is a three player game in which players try to collect sets of four cards. The object of the game is to avoid being left with the Hades card when the game finishes and thus being banished to his dark kingdom. When Tartarus begins, all thirteen cards are dealt to the three players. Play proceeds clockwise. Each player may swap any card (except Hades) for the face-up card or give any card they like "including Hades) to the player on their left, taking a card in return. The aim is to make a set of four cards: Zeus, Hera, Artemis, Apollo; Ares, Hephaestus, Aphrodite, Hermes; or Athena, Poseidon, Demeter, Dionysus. The first person to make a set calls out "Olympus!" The loser is then the person who is left with Hades.

The Ten Commandments is a card game where players match or fulfill instructions on the top card of a face up stack with cards from their hand. There are cards for each of the 10 commandments as well as cards for various commandment groupings and New Testament teachings. The commandment grouping cards require a set of commandment cards to be played. If a player cannot play a card, they draw another. The player that is able to play all of their hand first wins the game.

Game includes 90 game cards as well as 4 other cards that have the instructions for the game as well as other information.

La Batalla de Cardedeu is a wargame on the Battle of Cardedeu (also known as the Battle of Llinars), which took place on December 16th 1808 near the town of Cardedeu].

In the battle 15,000 French troops commanded by Saint-Cyr faced some 9,000 Spanish troops commanded by Vives and Reding. The historical result was a French victory.

item.description: This is not so much of a game as a device for simulating a tennis match. The board holds a score board and four rotating randomizers. The server rotates her handle to first serve and back to the start, revealing a type of shot (Drop shot, ace, forehand, etc). The receiver rotates his handle to the type of ball served, and back again, revealing a player a return stroke (winner, lob, volley, out, etc). If the receiver hits a return shot the server replies using "general play dial" and so on till some-one gets a "winner" or "out" result. If you know the rules of tennis, it's obvious how to simulate a match given these rules.

name.value: PLAY BALL: The great game of softball-baseball

item.description:
From the box - An exiting game of strategy for beginners or adults and fun for the whole family.
Playball teaches the fundamental elements of Softball and Baseball, and the "plays" and strategies of a real game.
"STRIKE OUT" the batters, hit a "HOME RUN" with bases full, go for extra bases and counter the opposition's play.
You make the important decisions.

List of contents:
 1 Playing-field Gameboard
 1 Scoreboard
84 Batting cards
56 Fielding cards
28 Caught? cards
28 Bonus cards
 3 Indicator arrows (spinners)
 7 Scoreboard pegs
 8 Team "players"
 1 Rules and Commence Play sheet

Approved by the Australian Softball Federation, and the Australian Baseball Federation.
Designed and made in Australia
Suitable for 10 years to adults.

A game that appeared in The Economist Magazine's Christmas 2008 issue. It is also available a print and play game from The Economist's Web site.

From the Economist:"As though readers haven't suffered enough already this year, we are offering them a chance to be crushed, humiliated, and impoverished all over again.

But we are also offering a shot at redemption. Our Board game pits players against each other and encourages them to pick on the weakest, kick opponents when they are down and generally manifest all the characteristics that bring success in the financial world. WINNER TAKES ALL!"

Players move round by throwing four coins and progressing as many squares as they throw heads. If a player throws four heads, he moves forward four spaces and has another turn; if he throws four tails, he throws again. When a player lands on a + square, he collects money from the bank; equally, when he lands on a minus square, he pays the bank.

The aim is to be the last solvent player. In order to achieve this, players try to eliminate the competition. Risk cards encourage players to pick on each other.

item.description:
The object of the game is to be the first to move all of your troops from your camp to your headquarters, while keeping your enemies from getting their troops to their headquarters.

- Use the helicopter pads to quickly move around the
 board.
 - Navigate to slide zones to capture multiple enemy
 troops.
 - Move troops strategically to guard your prison.
 - Escape from an enemy prison while they are not
 watching, or send a troop on a rescue mission.

What makes P.O.W. so unique?

- The ability for players to enter or leave the game
 at any time, with very little disruption to the
 game flow.
 - Players joining an existing game have a very good
 chance of winning.
 - The game board expands to the size needed depending
 on the number of players, eliminating wasted time
 traveling over unoccupied territory.

P.O.W. has all the ingredients needed to produce a classic board game:

Strategy – When to take a prisoner, when and how to guard your prison, what man to move, when to rescue and when to make a mad dash for headquarters.

Luck – The roll of the dice.

Loads of fun – Getting together with family and friends.

Scram Ball

This game comes from Transogram and includes wooden balls and a spinner like device which hits the balls which then land in different holes that have different value. The game was advertised on the box as a "Gold Medal Toy"

Freedomland Game USA by Pressman

Game comes with the "spin" board which features Janie and Johnny Freedom, and has red and black numbers and a little spinner. On the lower left side of the spinning board, there is a small slot to put the "souvenir cards". There are also 2 small "chess-like pawn" pieces that represent each player to be used on the game board. There are 19 of the little game pieces/souvenir cards.

You use the Pony Express, Santa Fe Express, Big Sternwheeler, or Stagecoach for a thrilling cross country race!

from the Warp Spawn site:

Sector Control

INTRODUCTION
Board and Card game for 2-4 players. 
Space Conquest Theme.

VICTORY
The first player to amass 500 Victory Points (VP) is the winner.

SECTOR MAP
The map is a 6 X6 grid composed of 36 Tiles. 
Tiles are also referred to as Sectors and Spaces. 
There are 9 types of Tiles and 4 Copies of each: 
1. Economic Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Economic Bonus +1
2. Research Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Research Bonus +1
3. Military Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Military Bonus +1
4. Espionage Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Espionage Bonus +1
5. Exploration Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Exploration Bonus +1
6. Culture Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Cultural Bonus +1
7. Logistics Sector Owner of this Sector gets a Draw Bonus +1
8. Strategic Sector Controler of this Sector gets +2 VP in Control Phase
9. Hazard Sector No one may build Colonies in this Sector
Sectors that share a side are adjacent. 
Sectors diagonal to each other are not adjacent.

COLONY COUNTERS
Each player get a set of counters of a unique color. 
These represent his colonies. 
Colonies can be built and destroyed, but they cannot be moved.

OCCUPATION AND CONTROL OF SECTORS
If you have at least 1 Colony in a sector you are said to occupy it. 
If you have more Colonies in a sector than any other player, you are said to 
Control it. The terms own and dominate can also be used. 
If 2 or more players occupy a sector and no one controls it, the 
Sector is said to be disputed.

VICTORY POINTS
Players record VP they accumulate with paper and pencil.

from the Warp Spawn site:

Villa Rustica a game of Senators and Slaves

INTRODUCTION
Each player is a Senator of the Roman Empire. 
Players compete for Gold, Influence, and Prestige.

VICTORY
The first player to accumulate 100 or more Prestige Points is the Winner.

from the Warp Spawn Site:

INTRODUCTION
Board Game for 2-4+ players. 
From the 12th to the 16th century trade in the Baltic Sea was controlled by an 
organization of German merchants known as the Hanseatic League. 
Each player takes the role of a Hansa Captain of a single Merchant ship (Cog).

VICTORY
The first player to accumulate 100 Gold wins the game.

THE BOARD
The board depicts Northern Europe including Scandinavia and parts of England and Russia. 
13 Cities are marked on the map. 
These are the main cities where the Hanseatic League conducted business. 
The cities are connected by lines called trade routes.

from Warp Spawn Site:

INTRODUCTION
Card game for 2-4 players. 
India circa 1700's
Each player controls a European power that has 
Colonial ambitions in India.

THE COLONIAL POWERS
Each player must pick as his identity one of the 4 Powers: 
Portuguese, Dutch, English, French

END OF GAME

from the Warp Spawn site:

Each player controls a European power that has 
Colonial ambitions in the Caribbean (West Indies) Circa 1550-1750.

Each player must pick as his identity one of the 4 Powers: 
Spanish, Dutch, English, French
All players must be of a different power.

VICTORY
The player with the most Victory Tokens (VT) at the end of the game wins.

END OF GAME
The game ends after 20 rounds. 
Each Round Represents 10 Years.

This Hasbro Game comes from 1969. The only thing that we know about the game is that (from the cover) "The winner picks a pop from the LOLLI-POP Tree". More research is obviously being done on the game. Picture of box comes from Ebayer Up-Your-Attic.
Object of the game is to move around the board accumulating completed gifts. Player with the most when the game ends wins!

A manual dexterity game of a "role and move" nature. 
Use the shooter to launch your "Little Flipper" on to the board, and try to land on high scoring areas, while trying to avoid "danger" areas that score no points. Move your diver around the board the number of spaces that "Little Flipper" landed on. If you land on "Big Flipper", on the board, you score 3 points, and get to launch your "Little Flipper" again. Pick up your treasure chest on the way, and the first one back to the boat is the winner.

A dice and card game using Railroad logos. No statistics - just fun! Designed for 3-10 players, EL gets better the more people that play. Appropriate for the entire family, ages 10 and up.
 Six specialty dice
183 card deck
Scoresheets
Rulebook
Sample Turn folder
Licensing Acknowledgments and Historical website folio
 The dice and cards show 32 different Railroad Logos which regulate play. Each player represents a Tycoon chosen at random. Each Tycoon has unique play abilities and victory conditions. The object is to reach your maximum Rolling Stock points.
 There are 5 categories of Rolling Stock. You begin with one Agent and may acquire more - Agents allow you to take Points from your competitors. Every turn, each Tycoon rolls the dice and draws/plays cards to earn more Points. Cards can be saved to hire more Agents or used against your opponents to take Points. Playing time is 1 - 4 hours depending on how many players you have. 3-4 players takes 1-1.5 hours [less for experienced players], while 10 players is more of a party atmosphere that can go for up to 4 hours[again-usually much less for experienced players].

This Limited Edition printing is strictly limited to 100 numbered copies.

item.description: Volta is played on a round wooden board. Each player has a square wooden playing piece with a marble on top and tries to push the other player off the board without their own marble rolling off. Since it is possible to push their own marble over the edge in one's first move (and therefore lose), the game takes anything from one second to maybe a minute.

item.description:
Each player has a wooden board which is placed on a number of wooden columns in two different strengths. The columns have to be removed without toppling the "building".
There are several other games in the rule booklet. Notably "Breitseite", in which "pirate ships" are built, then columns are fired at the other ship to topple the masts.

name.value: Littlest Pet Shop: Hideaway Haven Game

item.description:
"All the pets are hanging out in their favorite hiding spots and it's time for them to go home. But first you have to find them. The Dragonfly, Tiger Cat, Dog, and Ferret are here to help you search the different locations to find all four of your pets (one Cuddliest Pet, one Fanciest Pet, one Friendliest Pet and one Sportiest Pet). Then you'll need to catch the Dragonfly to help you get home. Be the first to gather your pets and catch the Dragonfly and you win!"

Each player receives a board with four different pets to recover (each from a different area of the game board.) Spin the spinner and move the helper pets to locate your target pets. Once you've collected all four, grab the dragonfly and you win!

item.description:
This is a tabletop system that can be used as a companion rule set to Samaris: Der Turm von Osma which can be played both solitaire and in groups, either as a strategic game or in a role-playing manner. It extends the game by individual character properties and rules for special movement and actions as well as tables for items and costs and for spells.
The game comes as a 53-page rule book in A4 format.

This is one of the statistics-based sports simulation games of Lambourne's. It is a replay simulation of English domestic one-day cricket (Refuge Assurance League, Benson & Hedges Cup, National West Bank Trophy). In these leagues play is limited to 40 overs (hence the name) to make sure that the game can be finished in one day, which is in contrast to standard cricket and international matches where a game can take some days to finish.
The game comes with a player list. Player statistics are based on real-world players, rated for batting, wicket-keeping and, if appropriate, bowling. Weather and pitch conditions are taken into account, and the events are then determined by rolling dice against the player stats.

This is a sort of roulette played with two dice, one white and one red. Players wager on what they think the next rolls will be. The wagers are placed on a 6 x 6 felt grid. There are 4 types of chips that can be wagered. Two are actually rings that will encircle another player's small chip bet, presumably to allow its capture.

This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Mannheim-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

TCSW is a set of tabletop rules for 5 to 54 mm miniatures and corresponding ground scales of 1mm to one inch per yard. The rules are meant to replay 20th century small unit skirmish scenarios, from about WW I through Vietnam, including commando actions and even police actions.
The rule set comes in three A4-sized booklets; the first 40-page booklet covers the basic rules and contains a hand-written refernce table sheet, the Tables and Lists booklet (27 pages) holds, well, tables and lists, and the Supplement (32 pages) provides special infantry rules as well as information about transport, weather and time, smoke and gas etc. The tables booklet also holds an extensive bibliography with sub-sections Personal Accounts, Campaigns, tactics and Units, Uniform Details, Weapons, and Fiction.

Pond Hockey is an abstract, highly tactical game for 2 players that simulates an informal hockey match played by two teams of 6 players on a frozen pond.

Each player acts as a coach for one of the two hockey teams. Both coaches have a draw deck of 10 cards. A card drawn from the top of the deck at the beginning of a turn, determines the number of movements points the coach will have available to move one or more players and/or to move the puck (be it by passing or by shooting the puck on goal). After the draw deck has been exhausted, the drawn cards are shuffled to form a new one. The match ends after the draw deck has been exhausted for the third time; so, after 30 "minutes" or 3 "periods" of play. The coach whose team has scored the most goals wins the game. If the scores are tied, the game can go into "sudden death" overtime, where the first team to score a goal will win the game.

The game's movement system was inspired by Corné van Moorsel's StreetSoccer but adapted to handle the difference in how a soccer ball can travel versus how a hockey puck can travel: more than one player can be moved on a turn; players can move with and retain possession of the puck; the puck travels in a straight line and it may only change direction if it comes into possession of another player who moves with it or passes it again or if it is deflected off the boards bordering the ice surface. The game also adds rules to permit poke-checking, body-checking, and assessing penalties.

link.value: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

item.description:
The chicken have escaped from the yard to the island where there's more excitement. But now they are lost. The hen mothers have to go and find them and bring them back to the yard.

Up to four hen mothers look for their three chickens, the magnets at heir feet sees to it that they only follow their own mother. The hen mothers move around the island with the help of the colored dice. The player first to bring back three chickens has won.

name.value: Welpe Winnie. Welpe Winnie hat sich verirrt! Hilf ihm, den rechten Weg zu finden!

item.description:
Help the lost puppy Ville back to the dog house. To succeed you'll need to find his leash, bone, food and water cup.

Contents:
1 game board
1 puppy
4 dog houses
16 item chits
1 spinner

Help the duck family into the pond. The little ducklings want to take the plunge into the pond but they are very scared, so they'll need a small push from the players. The Duck Family is a fun game for young children that trains their color memory and dexterity.

Tegn og Gæt Platinium is a complete remake of the 1989 game Tegn og gÃ¦t.

Players compete in teams about who is best in drawing and guessing the many creative assignments. Can you draw a "desert rat" or the sentence "the meatball flies over the fence"? The players have to use their fantasy if the team cannot guess the right answer before the time runs out the other team gets to guess. The teams get points for correct guesses within the time limit, the team with the most points wins.

Re-implements:

 Tegn og gÃ¦t
A charades-like party game where players team up and compete by guessing on mimics and gestures.

item.description:
Goal of the game:

Beat Doctor Hell and become Mazinger Z. All players want to become the invincible Mazinger Z, but only one can get. To achieve this you'll have to fight among themselves and the then the survivor will have to defeat Doctor Hell.

Components of the game. 
One board, one dice and 12 plastic chips.

Here is Domina 4. Be careful. It may cause a headache!

What you need to play Domina 4:

- 25 square tiles in 5 colours (5 each).
- 5 black pawns.
- 5 white pawns.

Randomly configure a 5x5 board using the 25 coloured tiles so that no 2 tiles of the same colour are orthogonally connected. You can draw a board if you don't have tiles.

Placing phase: White starts. Players in turn place ONE of their pawns in any empty square of the board until all the pawns have been placed.

Moving phase: White starts. Players in turn MUST move ONE of their pawns 1 square up, down, left or right to an empty square.

The game ends when one of the players ‘dominates’ the board by having placed 4 of its pawns in 4 squares of the same color.

item.description:
This is a party game where players vote on 32 contenders in a NCAA tournament like bracket. A contender advances to the next round when they receive a majority of the votes of the players. The players vote based on a question asked. For example, the contenders in the first round might be "Dolly Parton" vs. "street mime". The question might be, "Who would you rather be for a day?" All the players debate the match-up and then all openly vote on it. Play continues like this for each match-up.

Each player makes their picks, and gets their points based on what contender they believe will win the entire tourney(4), who will make it to the championship round(2 for each pick), who will make it to the final four (1 for each pick), and a bonus pick(4). The bonus pick is where each player tries to guess what one of the other players will choose as the winner of the tournament. The points for each pick is in parentheses.

The contenders are drawn randomly from 500 tiles and placed on the bracket in four categories (including an example of one contender from each.)
Arenas - aka "Places" - Jamaica
Contenders - aka "People" - Mark Twain
Moves - aka "Actions" - Showering
Gear - aka "Things"- Cocktails

After all the tiles are placed, a player draws a random "Knockout"card. This "Knockout" card is the question for the final, championship round. Once every player sees that question, they make their picks and place them in an envelope until the end of the game.

The object is make accurate picks as well as secretly convince the other players to pick your choices.

item.description: Be the first to acquire a corporation in each of the four areas of the globe to become MULTINATIONAL. But a player must acquire these corporations by payment in the local currency of the area of the board in which they are located. To get necessary currency to buy up corporations, a player must trade or exchange his own money for other "foreign" currencies, always seeking to get the best deal possible. He must then travel into the area on the board in which he wishes to purchase a corporation, But look out someone is trying to de-value your currencies,Terrorist Kidnap! your Chairman of the Board or Takeover your corporation. Its a game of "Getting Even " and Come from behind winners. Power, intrigue, money mad moguls, and international wheeler-dealers.

This game appears to be an Air Combat version of Battleship. Each player has two pegboards. One pegboard is hidden behind a screen in which the player secretly places his pieces. The other peg board is played in the open and used to track which points have been identified. Game Pieces differ in sizes from occupying between two to four peg holes. Game lasts slightly longer than a typical game of Battleship.
A local historical game based on the local Lancaster, Oxford & Southern Railroad (Peach Bottom Railroad) in Pennsylvania, USA.

Epic is a trading card game that doesn't use resource cards. Instead, every player has one action per turn (including your opponent's turn). The most powerful cards cost your action and other cards are free. The biggest decision point each turn is usually which card in your hand to use your action on and how and when to use that card.

Each player starts with a score of 30 Mojo. Player's use champion, object, and event cards to try and reduce their opponent(s)'s Mojo to zero.

The game comes in 15 card packs. Each pack is specially sorted and balanced so that you can shuffle any 2 packs together and have a playable 30 card deck.

item.description:
California Rummy is a 3 – 8 player variant of the standard deck playing card game Contract Rummy. Seven hands are played with each initial meld requirement of “sets” and/or “runs” getting progressively harder each time. As the requirements go up so do the number of cards dealt.

The game uses “draw and discard” mechanics as well as the ability for anyone in the game to “buy” a card if the player whose turn it is does not want the card. The card is purchased by also taking a “penalty card” from the unused stock.

An individual hand ends when one player goes out by either melding or “laying off” all of their cards in hand. All others count their hand point totals against them. At the end of the 7 rounds, the player with the least amount of total points is the winner.

item.description:
The players are ants building an anthill. They have to finish the anthill before Anthony the anteater reaches them, because only then the ants are safe from Anthony's long trunk. To build the anthill, the players have to find twigs on the back of the path cards. These twigs have to be collected and brought to the anthill, but this only works if a continuous line of ants leads up to them. 
It's a cooperative game, but the rulebook contains a competition variation as well.

item.description:
Medio-Milenio is a trivia game based on the relationship between Spain and Latin America. Its main theme is the encounter among the two worlds. 
In the game, this encounter is reflected as a journey depicted on the board between Europe and America or the other way round. The players can choose where to start their journey and will be answering questions during it.
The questions have four different levels and are all related with the history, arts, tradition and facts of the two continents.

The game was released as a commemoration of the 500th anniversary of Christopher Columbus' reaching landfall in America in 1492.

Alba is played on a 7 x 7 board with the inner 5 x 5 area used for the initial setting, the middle cell is left empty. Red and Blue place their pieces in turn, the neutral (white) side is on the bottom. Then players start to move to neighboring cells or try to jump hostile pieces. The jumped or the jumping piece is then flipped. The aim of the game is to neutralize the opposing forces by flipping or by reaching a cell on the edge of the board or even by jumping overboard.

Krypton is played on a 7×7 board with the corners and the middle cell being left empty. Among the friendly pieces four marked men are hidden, who can only be recognized from the backside. Aim of the game is to occupy both hostile corners with the marked men or to capture at least three marked hostile pieces.

Osmosis is a race game from the corners to the center of the board driven by two six-sided dice. Pieces‘ way may be shortened when reaching certain positions:
Two own pieces of different colors must reach the same cell or the cell lying exactly opposite on the same ring. That player wins who manages to bring both a man of his two different colors to the center. Generally, not the lucky one will win Osmosis, but the one with better experience in the calculus of probability.

Adversa is for those who know the game of Surakarta: But this war game has been changed into a positional game where groups of four are to be formed. As in Surakarta some edge cells are supposed to be connected, the same is in Adversa but with two rings more. Diagonal moves may lead over the edges, then changing direction in a right angle. Object of the game is to decimate opponent’s forces to less than four.

Diamonds is a positional game with the object of forming groups of four pieces of any size. All men move like the Queen in Chess with the additional force of over-leaping friendly and hostile pieces. Whoever forms a diamond may
decimate opponent’s forces. The player loses when he/she has only three men left.

Kuala has the object of building a tower of five elements height and is played on a 49-cell board. Pieces initially are arranged as shown in the photo. If a piece is standing in front of an opposite man and the cell beyond is occupied by a friendly stone, it may jump on this friendly stone. A stone standing in front of a hostile piece and the cell immediately beyond being empty may capture the enemy piece like in Laska. A column sandwiched between two hostile pieces becomes immobile until one of the two stones is captured.

Carree is played on an octagonal 3×4 board, which is initially empty. Players try to sandwich hostile pieces (custodian capture) or to move between them (intervention capture). A player loses when he/she has only four men left. Pieces may move over the edges of the board thus changing direction in a right angle.

The game consist of a number of bricks randomly placed in a matrix. Each brick has a known value. The players alternate in picking the bricks, one horizontally and the other vertically.

The name of the game in Swedish has two different meanings "matrix" and "food rice", and the game is actually published by a swedish food producer.

Players collect complete pictures that consist of four pieces each. The pieces are stacked up in eight stacks in the middle of the table, partly visible. The players try to get the pieces they need and block other players' plans (they can take pieces away from unfinished pictures). Whoever completes the most pictures is the winner.

Tiles with pictures of dragon parts are placed on the table and marked with chips of the player who placed them. The goal is to get the longest continuous chain of tiles marked with your own color. The tiles form a picture of intertwined dragons.

Players play for tricks while trying to get rid of their cards first. Whoever cannot follow the suit of cards with which the first player opened, has to take all the cards that have already been played in this trick.

One of Piatnik's 1989 "Texas-Serie".

One player plays Rotkäppchen (Little Red Riding Hood), the other plays the wolf. Little Red Riding Hood runs through the forest and trying not to be seen by the wolf. Game goal is for Red Riding Hood, to reach the blue and white box in the corners and then come to the meadow in the middle of the plan, without being seen by the wolf. The wolf has won, if he even sees Little Red Riding Hood. The cards are stacked face down and players take turns, depending on the card, Red Riding Hood may move in all directions, the wolf may move only horizontally and vertically. The wolf sees Little Red Riding Hood if an imaginary line between the two sites is not running on a dark green tree field.

Tip 'n' Tap Game by Whitman. It is dated 1965 Western Publishing Co. Comes with 6 balls. Object of the game is to place the balls on one side of the gameboard and then with a slight tap of a center button send those balls to the other side where depending on where they finish scores points.

The players collect ingredients for baking a cake. The ingredients are colored markers that are collected by rolling dice. Once the ingredients are complete, the players roll a "baking die" with which they move forward on a clock. When a player completes the baking time, he or she is the winner.

This game contains unusual (patented by the author, actually) 4-sided dice. With these, the players roll color combinations with certain values (seen in a chart in the middle of the game board) to determine how fast they can move.

Satirical game in which the object is to rent an apartment. In order to do this, you have to drop off your children and pets in a shelter, rob other players of their money, buy forged documents etc. Most of these actions are achieved by simple dice rolls.

A game master reads or sings the beginning of a children's song or chant. The children players then have to find a tile with a picture that matches the song/chant.
It is a same game as later published Jetzt fahrn wir ubern See (Drei Magier Spiele)

Luck based combined card/dice game. A player rolls two dice which determine whether he or she can put a card openly in front of him or her. There are some special cards that allow placing cards face down in front of another player, which then count negative points. When a player runs out of hand cards, the game ends. Open cards count plus, face down cards count minus points.

Fat Sam is a spin and move, memory game. From the box cover: "The wildest wackiest memory game ever featuring the world's craziest bunch of characters." Game comes with a Fat Sam spinner and a bunch of Character cards.

This is one of a series of abstract strategy games from Wales Game Systems, all branded with a Western theme after another of their games, 64-32 Ranch Roundup.

Description taken from inside the game's box:

EQUIPMENT

Board: The playing board consists of four home sections, each having nine numbered circles upon which are placed the nine playing pieces of one color, each piece on its own number.

Playing Pieces: Four sets of playing pieces are provided. Use the cowboys numbered from 1 to 9.

Play Money: $800.00 in 64-32 Ranch Play Money is provided. Before the game this money is divided so each player has $200.00.

OBJECT

The object of the game is for each player to advance his cowboys around the board by moving and jumping until all of them have been returned to their respective starting positions in the home corral. The first player to complete the moving of all his cowboys around the board wins his game.

Three chips ("drops") are placed randomly on the 3 x 3 gameboard. A game master then draws a card which contains a pattern. The players take turn in moving individual drops on the board, and the game master tells them how many are in the right positions. The first player to build the correct pattern gets the card; whoever has most cards at the end of the game, wins.

From the designer's website:

"Combines the best elements of Scrabble®, Boggle® & Bingo! Each Player controls their own board, and as letters are randomly selected, decides where to place them. The player who makes the highest scoring words wins! Play solitaire or with any number of friends."

From the rules:

"Independence! is a strategy game for 3-5 Players, who compete as Colonial Governors during the American revolution. A game is comprised of three years, and each year Players select a new Colony to govern. There are two turns in each year; six turns in a complete game (or 5 turns in a short game).

Independence! is based on historical facts about the 13 original colonies, and the major events of that time period. However, the wide variety of Player choices and random events cause each game of Independence! to develop differently."

From the designer's site:

"A 2-person space epic for board gamers, inspired by Master of Orion ®, my favorite PC game. Managing your empire’s resources is critical as you expand from a single star system to the dominant power in the galaxy. Incredible diversity, yet can be played in a single evening."

From the designer's site:

"A bidding/military conquest game for 3 or 4 players. Recruit the best officers to lead your armies in Part I of the game, then choose how to deploy them in a battle for Europe in part II. Medici ® players will love the myriad of factors that influence the bidding, and fans of Stratego ® will appreciate the familiar officer corps."

From the designer's site:

"A challenging word game for 2 or more players. Each player gets their own board and a set of blue, green and gold tiles. Each round, players draw 4 of each color tile, then arrange the tiles to form words on their board. The trick is that in any word, only one color tile will score at full value. Double squares and secret wagers add to the excitement."

From the designer's site:

"A futuristic 'fighter pilot' game for 2 to 4 players. Players’ ships circle the solar system, shifting orbits and speeds to gain position on their targets. Beautiful components simulate the cockpit of your starship, while special technology cards and random planet placement insure that each game will present new challenges."

From the rules:

"Space Chess is a futuristic strategy game for 2 people. The download package includes a 14"x14" game board (separated into 2 files for printing), red and blue Fleet Strength sheets, red and blue Fleet Orders pads, red and blue King pads, and all pieces needed for the game.

Each player commands a fleet of 6 ships, represented by chess pieces on the game board, and by icons on Fleet Order pads (you can use either chess pieces from a small chess set for movement on the board, or ship tokens, which are included).

The game board is divided into 64 Quadrants. A Quadrant is made up of 9 Sectors, each referred to by its compass position in the Quadrant: N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW and C(enter). There are three types of Quadrants: Type I (Light Red), Type II (Light Green) and Type III (Yellow). Both Quadrant Type and Sector location affect ship movement and combat capabilities.

The object of the game is to locate and destroy your opponent’s King ship. King ships are initially placed on King pads rather than on the game board, keeping their location hidden."

From the rules:

"Welcome to Mayor of Metropolis!® This unique game of real estate development for 2-4 players offers far more choices, and demands more complex strategies than other real estate games. Amazingly, games progress quickly, and victory is often achieved in less than one hour.

Streets in Mayor of Metropolis® are five blocks long. Properties can be developed with homes, condos or retail stores. Because you don't need a 'monopoly' to build, you will constantly be making choices about where to build, what to build and when to build.

Players can see at a glance who owns every property by simply by looking at their CityPad.® You'll have chances to speculate in rural land, municipal bonds to bid for, and most importantly, an elections strategy to plan.

In Mayor of Metropolis®, you can win by popularity with the voters, as well as through sheer economic power. Since the elections occur at different times in each game, you'll spend countless hours trying to develop winning strategies!"

From the rules:

"Space Trader is a bidding strategy game for 2 or 3 Players, in which a contest is held by selected member worlds of the Alliance. Players are given comparable cargo holds of Goods. Each world desires different types of Goods, such as weapons or chocolate, and will award Credits to the Player who offers them the highest quantity of the goods they want. After 3 rounds of trading, the Player with the most Credits wins."

From the designer's site:

"A multi-player colony development game, inspired by Outpost ® . Each player decides the best way to grow their colony, with lots of bidding and resource allocation throughout the game. Alpha Base delivers three hours of challenging choices and intense competition!"

From the designer's site:

"An exciting game of strategy for 2 players. Through bidding, purchases and training, both players prepare their knights for the duel that will determine the winner. Each of the game's four stages rewards a different type of skill, so the possibilities are amazing!"

From the designer's site:

"An easy to learn word game for 2 or 3 players. Letters are Red, Green and Blue Tiles, with White and Gold special Tiles. Tiles only score if they're placed on the right color square!"

From the designer's site:

"A 2-person war game played on a different map each time. Loads of strategic and tactical decisions involving air, land and sea forces, circa mid-20th century technology. Acetate overlays allow for force reductions and map changes. Only for the serious... games last 20-40 hours."

Each card represents a State of the USA; players compete to create a hand of four adjacent States or alternatively a hand of same colour States with the highest point value.

From the designer's site:

"In this colorful card game for children and adults, each card is a different state. You can't help but learn geography when playing STATES; instead of memorizing, you learn by understanding."

name.value: Married! The Game of Marriage and Money

item.description:
From the back of the box:

"This exciting, positive game offers lots of fun as it takes you through the ups and downs of marriage and money-making. There's the opportunity to win it all or lose it all on the draw of a single card...

A game that is as modern as today, yet as old as marriage itself..."

name.value: Lucky Luke: Union Pacific vs. Central Pacific
Lucky Luke: Le Cheval de fer

item.description:
The publisher Dargaud usually releases comic books in France like Asterix or Lucky Luke.

So this game is featuring the Wild West hero Lucky Luke.

The game is outstandingly equipped with components.
You have among others a stagecoach traveling around the outer track, a loco traveling the inner track, workers in two different colours, signals, road blocks, a lot of play money and last but not least hundreds of cardboard rail segments in 3 different colours.

Aim of the game is to connect the eastern and western borders of the USA.
To achieve this you have to travel with your stagecoach in order to collect building material and to hire workers.
These have to be delivered to your hometown, and from then on you can choose what to do with your dice roll: Move on with your stagecoach or move your loco on the inner board to build the rails in order to achieve your goal first.

But beware: You have to maximize your money profits (railway building is expensive !!!) and to avoid your opponents who can rob your stagecoach or steal your stocks in hometown, because the loco can only transport as much as you have hired workers.

And even further your opponents can hinder your track building by forcing to add bridges to your railway or to make your workers flee from your company.

But one of the players can count for the help of the name-giving comic hero !

Winner is the first player to complete the track, build a second hometown and then travels back with his loco to his starting depot.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
On July 1, 1867, four of Britain's North American colonies united to form a self-governing dominion: Canada.

Canada is a game for three players covering the history of Canada from Confederation to the end of the Second World War.

Each player assumes the role of a political party striving to establish a legacy greater than its rivals’ by taking positions on political issues, winning elections, and expanding the dominion’s frontiers. To succeed, players will have to co-operate as well as compete. The winner will be the player who can best balance co-operation with competition.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Klaus die Maus entdeckt die Welt

item.description: Klaus the mouse traveled around the world and took a lot of pictures of many different things. But a strong wind mixed up all his pictures. The aim of the game is to help Klaus to spatialize the things to the continents where they originally come from. Therefore the players place their figure on a map of the world. If it is placed on the right continent, they get a chip. The first one who gets the 10th chip wins the game.

Is card game from the world of mafia. Each player is trying to reach the significant part of the most powerful people in the city. Be the first who control at least four of them and the city "victory" is yours.
Cards are divided in 3 categories
- Intriguer - necessary for activation of sentences
- Intrigue card - most in game - have 4 different meanings
1 - for composing of sentences (intrigues)
2 - symbol in right corner - sentences from cards with same symbol gives you additional advantage
3 - represent money
4 - can be played as single card
- Cards of powerful people in city (provost, taxi driver, pilot, murder, thief, ....)

Game is based on drawing a cards from witch you compose the sentences (each card contain part of the sentence), Longer sentences allow you to make more complex and powerful actions.
In each turn, you can just draw one card, and play one card.
Other advantages depend on composed sentences (intrigues).
Rules of the game are quit simple and in fact almost everything is allowed, so also depends on you how you are able to control and make deals with other players.

Simply - Fast and funny party game

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Each player chooses a magical creature to be their game piece. Players explore an island, gathering clues until they find the Selkie skin and defeat the guardian creature.

A spinner built into the board determines movement as well as battle outcomes. Players move to different parts of the board and make a hypothesis. This involves telling another player what you think is the creature guarding the Selkie's skin, and what part of the island. If that player is holding either card, they must reveal one, disproving the player's hypothesis. A player who thinks he or she knows the answers can make a guess and check the set aside cards. If they are incorrect, the player must go back to Start.

When a player guesses correctly, they must spin the spinner for a battle. If they spin the right magic weapon, they win the game. If they don't, the other players get to move.
Dig & Play Dinosaurs World is a kit which includes a block from which children can "excavate" dinosaurs, which then become the playing pieces in the roll-and-move board game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Squire Fight is a game played on a three by three grid. A spinner or die is used for movement on the grid, then used to decide the result of combat. When a player loses ten "hit points," he/she is out of the game.

This game is found in the book "Knight: A Noble Guide for Young Squires."

Be the first of My Little Pony characters to reach the Celebration Castle in Ponyville by stopping at every Rainbow space along the path to collect your six character tokens.

The youngest player starts. On your turn, spin the spinner and see which color it lands on. Move your pony to the next space of that color on the path. If another pony is already on the space move along to the path of the next available space of that color (unless it is the Rainbow space which can have more than one pony). If you land on or pass a Rainbow space, collect your pony's unique token.

Pony characters are: Sweetie Belle, Pinkie Pie, Starsong, Scootaloo, Cheerilee, Toola-Roola, and Rainbow Dash.

Players are considered to have wandered into the middle of a food fight. During the game each player (or team-member when playing with 4) throw food at each other, trying to gain the least food cards in front of them ("on them" in theme).

The game consists of 3 rounds. Each round begins with setting up the cafeteria table (2 stacks of cards to draft from). Each player in turn order chooses to one of three things: take 1 card, swap a card, throw food.

Each option will result in adding cards to your hand or giving them to your opponent(s). At the end of the last round all players add up how many types of food they have on them. The player with the least amount is declared the winner.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Sports Fuzz is a stand-alone game of stuffed toys and action figures playing a game of Fuzzball which oddly resembles American Football. The game is set in the "Fuzzy Heroes" world of FrolicHaven and pits Fuzzy Heroes vs Renegade teams for control of a folded paper football here called a Fuzzball.

Published by Inner City Games Design - Sports Fuzz! uses a variant of the Fuzzy Heroes miniatures combat system which stats the players based on toy size, colour and other factors and tosses in a fairly elaborate rules set for Football as played by toys. The game is not though compatible with the other Fuzzy Heroes games. The playing field can be a large table, a bed or better yet the floor. The triangular paper Fuzzball is flicked across the playing field by the team "Coach".
French cycling game about a lesser know race, the Tour of Guadeloupe, a race on a French island group in the Caribbean. The game comes with 24 cyclists, 4 for each player.

French cycling game from the 1950's. Four teams of 4 cyclists representing the countries France, Switzerland, Italy & Germany fight for victory. The mechanics are a combination of die with a spinner.

This game was a promotion for the "Mère Picon" cheese makers. Each cheese portion box included a cut-up rider and a bonus. If you sent 20 of these bonuses, you received the board.
French cycling game from the '50s based on the 6 day indoor cycling events. Original is that the metal cyclists are standing on a small plate that allows them to swing.
